name: Document
title: Gcloud
Search
Document
description:
Document

A document is an object that stores data that can be searched. Each document has a #doc_id that is unique within its index, a #rank, and a list of #fields that contain typed data. Its field values can be accessed through hash-like methods such as #[] and #each.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
search = gcloud.search
index = search.index "products"

document = index.document "product-sku-000001"
document.add "price", 24.95
index.save document
document.rank #=> 1443648166
document["price"] #=> 24.95

methods.name: doc_id
title: Gcloud
Search
Document#doc_id
methods.description: The unique identifier for the document. Can be set explicitly when the document is saved. (See Index#document and #doc_id=.) If missing, it is automatically assigned to the document when saved.

methods.name: doc_id=
title: Gcloud
Search
Document#doc_id=
methods.description:
Sets the unique identifier for the document.

Must contain only visible, printable ASCII characters (ASCII codes 33 through 126 inclusive) and be no longer than 500 characters. It cannot begin with an exclamation point (!), and it cannot begin and end with double underscores (__).

methods.name: rank
title: Gcloud
Search
Document#rank
methods.description: A positive integer which determines the default ordering of documents returned from a search. The rank can be set explicitly when the document is saved. (See Index#document and #rank=.) If missing, it is automatically assigned to the document when saved.

methods.name: rank=
title: Gcloud
Search
Document#rank=
methods.description:
Sets the rank of the document.

The same rank should not be assigned to many documents, and should never be assigned to more than 10,000 documents. By default (when it is not specified or set to 0), it is set at the time the document is created to the number of seconds since January 1, 2011. The rank can be used in Index#search options expressions, order, and fields, where it is referenced as rank.

title: Gcloud
Search
Document#[]
methods.description: Retrieve the field values associated to a field name.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
search = gcloud.search
index = search.index "products"

document = index.document "product-sku-000001"
puts "The document description is:"
document["description"].each do |value|
  puts "* #{value} (#{value.type}) [#{value.lang}]"
end

params.name: name
params.description:
The name of the field. New values will be
configured with this name.

methods.name: fields
title: Gcloud
Search
Document#fields
methods.description: The fields in the document. Each field has a name (String) and a list of values (FieldValues). (See Fields)

methods.name: add
title: Gcloud
Search
Document#add
methods.description: Add a new value. If the field name does not exist it will be added. If the field value is a DateTime or Numeric, or the type is set to :datetime or :number, then the added value will replace any existing values of the same type (since there can be only one).

examples.code:
require "gcloud" gcloud = Gcloud.new search = gcloud.search index = search.index "products" document = index.document "product-sku-000001" document.add "sku", "product-sku-000001", type: :atom document.add "description", "The best T-shirt ever.", type: :text, lang: "en" document.add "description", "

The best T-shirt ever.

", type: :html, lang: "en" document.add "price", 24.95

params.name: value
params.description: The value to add to the field.

params.name: type
params.description:
The type of the field value. An attempt is made to set the correct type when this option is missing, although it must be provided for :geo values. A field can have multiple values with same or different types; however, it cannot have multiple :datetime or :number values.

The following values are supported: * :default - The value is a string. The format will be automatically detected. This is the default value for strings. * :text - The value is a string with maximum length 10242 characters. * :html - The value is an HTML-formatted string with maximum length 10242 characters. * :atom - The value is a string with maximum length 500 characters. * :geo - The value is a point on earth described by latitude and longitude coordinates, represented in string with any of the listed ways of writing coordinates. * :datetime - The value is a DateTime. * :number - The value is a Numeric between -2,147,483,647 and 2,147,483,647. The value will be stored as a double precision floating point value in Cloud Search.

params.name: lang
params.description: The language of a string value. Must be a valid ISO 639-1 code.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
search = gcloud.search
index = search.index "products"

document = index.document "product-sku-000001"
document.delete "description"

methods.name: each
title: Gcloud
Search
Document#each
methods.description: Calls block once for each field, passing the field name and values pair as parameters. If no block is given an enumerator is returned instead. (See Fields#each)

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
search = gcloud.search
index = search.index "products"

document = index.document "product-sku-000001"
puts "The document #{document.doc_id} has the following fields:"
document.each do |name, values|
  puts "* #{name}:"
  values.each do |value|
    puts "  * #{value} (#{value.type})"
  end
end

methods.name: names
title: Gcloud
Search
Document#names
methods.description: Returns a new array populated with all the field names. (See Fields#names)

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
search = gcloud.search
index = search.index "products"

document = index.document "product-sku-000001"
puts "The document #{document.doc_id} has the following fields:"
document.names.each do |name|
  puts "* #{name}:"
end
